title: Jimmy Kimmel, Somber but Defiant, Defends Free Speech in Return to ABC
summary: The late-night star said he had not intended to make light of Charlie Kirk’s murder, but he also said that President Trump’s threat against ABC was “anti-American.”

title: The F.C.C.’s Brendan Carr Plans to Keep Going After the Media Following Jimmy Kimmel’s Return
summary: While “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” returned to ABC on Tuesday, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission has promised to continue his campaign against what he sees as liberal bias in broadcasts.

title: Like His Suspension, Kimmel’s Return Draws a Divided Reaction
summary: Ben Stiller, the actor and comedian, called Mr. Kimmel’s opening words a “brilliant monologue,” while some on the right questioned his authenticity.

title: After Days of Silence, Joe Rogan Weighs In on Kimmel’s Suspension
summary: The influential podcaster said, “I definitely don’t think that the government should be involved, ever, in dictating what a comedian can or cannot say in a monologue.”

title: Trump’s Big Flip on Ukraine, and a Defiant Jimmy Kimmel
summary: Plus, robot fight club.

title: Why Obamacare Bills May Double Next Year
summary: Extensive subsidies that reduce premium costs for millions are set to expire, unless Congress extends them.

title: In a Sudden Shift, Trump Says Ukraine Can Win the War With Russia
summary: President Trump’s pivot could give him room to distance himself from a conflict that he once promised to solve in days or weeks.

title: Trump’s U-Turn on Ukraine Was a Surprise, Zelensky Says
summary: The Ukrainian leader said in an interview on Fox News that Russia’s unwillingness to take steps toward peace had impacted the American president.

title: Despite Trump, the World Isn’t Slowing on Climate, E.U. Official Says
summary: Still, European nations are struggling to agree on how much to cut their greenhouse gas emissions, the E.U.’s climate commissioner said in an interview.

title: Escalator at U.N. Stops When Trump Steps On, Setting Off Conspiracy Theories
summary: A sudden stop just as President Trump stepped on the stairs may have been caused by the triggering of a safety mechanism, the U.N. said.

title: The Pentagon, the Press and the Fight to Control National Security Coverage
summary: Journalists have long shaped history through scrutiny of the military. Now the Defense Department plans to cut off access for reporters who publish even unclassified information without official approval.

title: Under Trump Policy, Bonds for Immigrants Facing Deportation Are Vanishing
summary: The president has limited immigration judges’ power to release detainees facing deportation. Immigrant rights groups say the policy is illegal.

title: South Koreans Describe Fear and Anger After Georgia ICE Raid
summary: Some of the workers arrested this month at a Hyundai-LG factory said that although they had entered the United States under murky circumstances, they had always planned to return home.

title: This Conquistador Changed History. Neglect Haunts His Tomb in Mexico
summary: Hernán Cortés toppled the Aztecs, winning Mexico for Spain. His trash-strewn resting place reflects how the conquest is still fueling quarrels and testing ties with Spain.

title: On Covid and Autism, Trump Strays From the Science
summary: President Trump has used his position of authority to dole out flawed medical advice dating back to his first term, when he mused about injecting bleach to kill off the coronavirus.

title: Trump Pushes Unproven Link Between Tylenol and Autism
summary: Top U.S. health officials urged pregnant women not to use acetaminophen, the active ingredient in Tylenol, claiming it could cause autism, though studies have been inconclusive. Azeen Ghorayshi, a science reporter for The New York Times, explains.

title: Why Take Tylenol During Pregnancy? The Risks of Fevers.
summary: Fevers during pregnancy can be dangerous, and acetaminophen is the go-to treatment for them. Doctors worry what will happen if women are afraid to take it.

title: Relief, Grief and Pain as Gaza’s Wounded Are Flown to Safety
summary: Hungry and injured passengers on a medical evacuation flight showed the toll of nearly two years of bombardment.

title: Aid Flotilla Headed for Gaza Says It’s Under Drone Attack
summary: The vessels were aiming to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza. The Israelis have asked that the aid be given to them to distribute.

title: 10 (More) Questions With Zohran Mamdani
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City, visited The New York Times for an interview.

title: Philanthropies Strike a Promising Deal to Turn Back H.I.V.
summary: Low- and middle-income countries will be able to purchase an effective preventative at a reduced price. The arrangements may help stem the epidemic 40 years after it began.

title: Camp Mystic to Reopen After Texas Floods, Over Objections From Victims’ Parents
summary: Twenty-seven children and counselors died in the Texas Hill Country camp, and many of their families expressed shock that the retreat on the Guadalupe River would be open for its 100th anniversary.

title: Claudia Cardinale, Actress Who Was ‘Italy’s Girlfriend,’ Is Dead at 87
summary: A sex symbol with girl-next-door appeal, she rose to fame in the 1960s and starred in more than 150 films, including the Oscar-winning ‘8½’ and ‘The Leopard.’

title: Moab Music Festival: A Glorious Place for Performance
summary: The Moab Music Festival offers some of the purest, most intense listening experiences around. But what happens when its signature river dries up?

title: America Is Blowing Up Boats and Asking Questions Later
summary: Even if the allegations are correct, blowing up the boats is a lawless exercise in the use of deadly force.

title: Autism Has Never Been One Thing
summary: We’ve come too far to go back to a time when autism was defined solely in terms of deficits and mothers were made to feel guilty.

title: Can the Justice Department Stay Independent Under Trump?
summary: The president wants the department to punish his foes and protect his friends.

title: Jimmy Kimmel’s Tearful Return to Late Night
summary: “I’m not sure who had a weirder 48 hours, me or the C.E.O. of Tylenol,” Kimmel said on Tuesday.

title: Moulton Readies Primary Challenge Against Markey in Massachusetts
summary: The coming Senate collision in the deep-blue state will be a test of the Democratic Party’s appetite for generational change.

title: A Curator Flees Bangkok After China Deems His Art Show Too Provocative
summary: A museum’s directors said Chinese and Thai officials pressured them to remove the names of artists whose works criticized China. The curator flew to London, fearing arrest.

title: Typhoon Ragasa Slams Into China After Deaths in Taiwan and the Philippines
summary: One million residents of Guangdong, in southern China, were evacuated before the powerful storm made landfall on Wednesday. At least 21 people have been killed along its path this week.

title: Joe Stevens, Photographer of Rock’s Intimate Moments, Dies at 87
summary: After a career shift, he became a fixture in the music world, capturing enduring images of David Bowie, John Lennon, the Sex Pistols and many others.
